Increasing temperatures & extreme weather are projected to harm our agriculture industry, threatening farming communities & food security. And our nation’s aging infrastructure will be pushed to the limits by extreme weather events, threatening our national security & economy.

Human health will be directly impacted by climate change, with extreme weather and climate-related events effecting our clean air and clean water, spreading diseases to new places, and increasing heat-related stress on vulnerable populations.

This Administration is committed to transforming the federal judiciary with extreme appointees who will bring bias to the bench and won’t uphold the ideal of equal justice for all Americans. I’ll do everything I can to stop them.

He compared the Supreme Court’s decision upholding the Affordable Care Act to the Dred Scott and Plessy v. Ferguson decisions—comments that are absolutely offensive to anyone with an understanding of American history.
Now, attorneys aren’t charged with their clients’ views, but Farr’s record calls into question his ability to be an impartial judge and he has done nothing to hide his extreme bias.

Farr has represented corporations that discriminated against customers and workers, including a car company that allegedly imposed additional requirements on Black customers and a pharma company that allegedly created a hostile work environment for its female workers.

Farr defended a voter suppression law in NC that a court said targeted Black voters with “almost surgical precision.” He advised Jesse Helms’ Senate campaign in 1990, which sent postcards to voters in heavily Black precincts falsely informing them they were ineligible to vote.

Economic justice is worth fighting for. Too many families are one $500 expense away from financial catastrophe. We need to pass the LIFT Act and the Rent Relief Act to put more money back in families’ pockets and help them keep up with the cost of living.

The rule of law is worth fighting for. In the Senate, we need the ability to advise and consent on lifetime appointments to the courts and to make sure these nominees reflect the best interests of our country.
Election security is worth fighting for. We need to devote more resources to upgrading states’ election systems and replacing antiquated voting machines.
Criminal justice reform is worth fighting for. We need to rethink sentencing guidelines and replace the cash bail system.
Voting rights are worth fighting for. We need to restore the full protections of the Voting Rights Act so that no eligible voter is ever denied the right to vote.
